paper.title: Risk factor aggregation and stress testing
paper.abstract: Stress testing refers to the application of adverse financial or macroeconomic scenarios to a portfolio. For this purpose, financial or macroeconomic risk factors are linked with asset returns, typically via a factor model. We expand the range of risk factors by adapting dimension-reduction techniques from unsupervised learning, namely PCA and autoencoders. This results in aggregated risk factors, encompassing a global factor, factors representing broad geographical regions, and factors specific to cyclical and defensive industries. As the adapted PCA and autoencoders provide an interpretation of the latent factors, this methodology is also valuable in other areas where dimension-reduction and explainability are critical.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要讨论了压力测试和风险因素聚合，这些是金融风险管理中的核心内容。论文中提到的PCA和自编码器等技术用于扩展风险因素的范围，并提高解释性，这些都是风险管理中的关键任务。
